\usepackage[margin=1in]{geometry}
\usepackage{amsmath,amssymb}
\usepackage{graphicx}
\usepackage{hyperref}
\usepackage[table]{xcolor}
\usepackage{enumitem}
\usepackage{multirow}
\usepackage{multicol}
\usepackage{array}
\usepackage{textcomp}
\usepackage{newcomputermodern}
\usepackage{setspace}
\setstretch{1.81}
\providecommand{\textsubscript}[1]{$_{\text{#1}}$}
\begin{document}

\begin{center}
\\\textbf{ Report Title }\\ Subtitle or Course Name \\ Author Name \\ Institution or Organization \\ "[month repr:long] [day], [year]" \\
\end{center}

\section*{Contents}
\tableofcontents

\section{Introduction}

Provide an overview of the report's purpose, scope, and structure. Explain what the reader can expect to learn.

\section{Background}

Present relevant background information, context, or theory needed to understand the main content.

\subsection{Subsection Example}

You can organize content into subsections for better structure.

\subsubsection{Further Nesting}

And nest even deeper if needed.

\section{Main Content}

This is where the primary content of your report goes.

\subsection{Methods}

Describe any methods, procedures, or approaches used.

\subsection{Analysis}

Present your analysis, findings, or main arguments.

\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\begin{tabular}{ccc}
\textbf{Category} & \textbf{Value} & \textbf{Notes} \\
Item A & 42 & Example data \\
Item B & 17 & More data \\
Item C & 89 & Additional info \\
\end{tabular}
\caption{Example table with data}
\end{table}

\subsection{Discussion}

Interpret and discuss the significance of your findings.

\section{Conclusion}

Summarize the key points and provide final thoughts or recommendations.

\section{References}

List your sources here in your preferred citation format.
\end{document}
